intro: Polygonum truncatum, commonly known as cut-leaved smartweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, ovate leaves that are often notched or truncate at the tip. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in moist soils, often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks. Polygonum truncatum is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
